Shadow worms are monstrous cave worms that dwell on the [Shadow Plane](/Equipment.aspx?ID=288). Larger and more cunning than most cave worms, shadow worms are fearsome predators that leave swaths of devastation in their wake. Most have glossy, black-armored hide, but those that burrow near [velstrac](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111) lands are streaked with dark red, for the blood the velstracs spill has soaked into the very stones these shadow worms consume. **[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 45 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 43 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 [Shadow Worm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2425) **Source** [Pathfinder #186: Ghost King's Rage](/Sources.aspx?ID=189) pg. 86 **Perception** +33; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [tremorsense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) (imprecise) 100 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +41, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +32 **Str** +10 **Dex** +2 **Con** +9 **Int** -4 **Wis** +0 **Cha** +0 --- **AC** 45 **Fort** +36 **Ref** +32 **Will** +30 **HP** 450 (shadow healing) **Resistances** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 20, [negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118) 20 **Weaknesses** shrink from the light **Inexorable** The shadow worm recovers from the [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35), and [stunned](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.
**Shadow Healing** As long as a shadow worm is in an area of dim light or darkness, it gains [fast healing 20](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15). When affected by a magical shadow effect from anything other than itself, a shadow worm becomes [quickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32) for 1 round.
**Shrink from the Light** A shadow worm takes an additional 20 damage from any spell or ability with the [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) trait and uses the outcome one degree worse for saving throws made against a spell or ability with the light trait. --- **Speed** 40 feet, burrow 40 feet **Melee** jaws +38 ([deadly 2d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d10+20 piercing plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Melee** body +38 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+20 bludgeoning **Breath Weapon** ([Cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) The shadow worm exhales a blast of clinging shadow, dealing 11d6 cold damage and 10d6 negative damage to creatures in a 60-foot cone (DC 42 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). If the cone passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100), Breath Weapon attempts to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the light (+34 counteract modifier). The shadow worm can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds. **Fast Swallow** **Trigger** The shadow worm [Grabs](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) a creature; **Effect** The worm uses [Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35). **Rock Tunneler** A shadow worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does. **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=35)** Huge, 3d10+15 bludgeoning, Rupture 42 **Thrash** The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
Midnight Worms Though the worms are generally considered to be untamable, some powerful velstracs have recently begun experimenting on shadow worms in hopes of transforming them into mutilated war beasts. So far, only two shadow worms have survived the velstrac's ministrations. The resulting horrors have been dubbed midnight worms.
